Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, but also out of the ordinary!”
Reviews.Author: vekkeo
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is quite a distance from the boardwalk, that can be a blessing in disguise. The hotel fronts an absolutely wonderful bayfront park that provides walking paths, a fishing pier, a children's play yard, and ball fields, and there are many restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is one of the cleanest and friendliest I have stayed in. We stayed in a king suite (get a room facing the park if you can, the sunset views are great!) Bed linens were fresh and crisp, and there was an abundance of thick, thirsty towels in the bathroom. There is no balcony in the room and no windows that open, but the room smelled fresh with no stale hotel smell. If you wish to take in the boardwalk, there is a bus system that runs the length of Ocean City 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. For $2, you can use the system for the entire day. Certainly a bargain. The outdoor pool was a great place for sunny warm afternoons, and there is also an indoor pool and hot tub. The ocean is an easy one block walk from the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and plan to return. I imagine in the height of the summer season, this hotel's location would be a welcome change from the congestion and crowds associated with the boardwalk/beachfront area.

Reviews.Title: “holiday in express in oc you cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: WNJS
Reviews.Content: i have been going to oc on business all summer (8 weeks) and staying at the holiday inn express. check inn is quick and friendly. my rooms have always been clean and neat. the breakfast buffet is good. both pools (indoor and outdoor) are always clean. most importantly the people staying at this hotel are respectful and quiet during the night. this place is priced right and for the best place to stay in oc i highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: timmyor
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Ocean City with my boyfriend, we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express. It was fantastic, we were happy with the entire stay there. I wen't on trip Advisor several weeks before our trip and read many reviews on this Hotel and "helpful" hints about the area. I had been to Ocean City about 9 years ago, I stayed at the hotel which is now the Clarion, and the Holiday Inn was just as wonderful! It was clean, everyone was very nice and helpful, the breakfast in the morning was wonderful and yes, the warm cinnamon rolls were great!! I highly recommend them! If you are not into kids, it's not the place for you, there were plenty of kids, all ages.... The park in the back of the Hotel was just wonderful, we walked every night, the moon and stars were beautiful over the bay... I would highly recommend this area for people who have kids, any age, and couples.. it was great, the beach was right across the highway, not far at all... we walked to a few places, there was a Subway shop and pizza right next door to us, which was good for fast food... and if you have ever been to Ocean City and like buffets, eat at the Bonfire, it's worth it.. I believe it' s on 60th st.. or close to that... we would definitely go back again and I wan't to thank those who also did a Trip Advisor review on this Hotel and rated it just as great as we did.. ps] our room was wonderful with the exception of a balcony, but it didnt matter, that was the worst thing about the whole place... worth the stay!!!! anne from NY

Reviews.Title: “Great For Famlies ”
Reviews.Author: james15
Reviews.Content: my wife and i and our two boys ages 12 and 8 stayed here from 7/14-7/21/07 ..this is our 2nd time staying here... we love it... the room was great ,two queen beds fridge and microwave... there are two pools one in and one out both very clean...the best part of the hotel is it is across the street from northside park... bike riding ,roller blading.walking, soccer fields baseball fields.also a pier to walk out into the bay an fish or crab... on sundays they have sundaies in the park ..you can make ice cream sundaies for a fee (small) and listen to a band ..the week we were there we heard the key west band paying tribute to jimmy buffet ...we all loved it ...we also went to see the delmarva shoebirds basball team...(a) of the baltimore orioles about 1/2 hour away in salisbury... we loved this hotel very friendly staff... continental bfast was good but they should have a more healty choice ...go to eat at tequila mockingbird a block away good food ... contact me at robert.carricato@us.icap.com for more info

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here June 29, 2007. The staff is friendly. The beds are comfortable. Room was clean. There are 2 pools, one indoor and one outdoor. The property is located across the street from Northside park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. As a priority club member, I took advantage of the late checkout option.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Longs1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here we booked the Holiday Inn Express on fairly short notice through this website and then through the Holiday Inn Express Online Reservations site. We booked a Standard Room and requested non-Smoking. Upon arrival we were told we were booked into a King Suite (one King and one pull out sofa) and it was a smoking room that they had placed an ionizer into. We asked to see the room - it wasn't very large and still smelled of smoke. We went back to the desk and complained, and they "found" a non-smoking King Suite like the one we saw, on the third floor. The pullout couch was too small to reasonably sleep two people unless they're really small kids, so we asked for a roll-away. They gave us one at no charge, and said they normally charge $15 per night for it. It isn't that good, but our 10-year old could sleep on it alright. The rooms aren't that big and the "kitchenette" is really just a very small sink with a smaller refrigerator underneath, and one double-cabinet about 15" high above the sink, with a microwave mounted underneath. Comes with a coffee maker but not a toaster. The lack of a balcony or window that opens makes the room claustrophobic. Cleanliness is pretty good overall, with the usual slight dust visibility around the perimeter of the room. There was plenty of dust behind the TV. The king bed is comfortable, but not the pullout sofa or rollaway bed. The bathroom is average sized for a cheaper hotel. When the staff gave us this room, they reminded us that it was an "upgrade" to have jets in the tub, but the jets have a lot of black sludge/mold in them and I wouldn't get in the tub and use the jets. The outdoor pool is larger than most, about 5 feet deep at its deepest, and seems fairly clean, we saw someone cleaning it most days. The indoor pool seemed murkier, and is smaller and only 3-1/2 feet deep. There's a hot tub with the indoor pool, and the heat was up but the jets were broken for our entire stay. The chaise lounges and tables use the standard plastic, but they were fine, didn't see any broken. There's plenty of parking on the side and back of the hotel, but the front is completely crowded with the Blue Ox restaurant in front and the "Olive Tree" restaurant on the left side of the hotel - there's no sense that the hotel has any of its own "grounds" to speak of. There is the Northside Park across from the back of the hotel, a pretty nice park overall. The breakfast is pretty basic - 4 cereals, bagels, tasteless english muffins, other mini muffins, the cinnamon rolls which were good but kind of heavy, one or two fruits - oranges, apples, bananas that were generally way too green, and coffee/tea and orange and apple juice. The women who work the breakfast really hustle and keep everything full, but it's all gone by the published 10:30 a.m. end time. The walk to the beach is pretty easy across coastal highway, there's beach access directly across from the hotel at 127th street. Overall, I wouldn't stay here with 4 people unless you are assured of two queen beds and the parties sharing the beds can get along in them - a problem for our two boys. If you enjoy a balcony, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay if you have kids.”
Reviews.Author: minamu
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to go to Ocean City for the first time, for the 4th of July. With a 7 year old. From everything I heard, it would be a way to get a slice of classic Americana beach/boardwalk experience. I chose this hotel because it had the best prices at the time I was looking, and practically everything else was totally booked. I was a bit wary because of the distance from the boardwalk and the fact that it is an Express, but I was pleasantly surprised. It can't be beat for the 4th of July if you have small kids and want a hassle-free 4th of July experience. The hotel is across the street from the beach. Up past the 100s, the beach is very nice and not crowded, so we didn't mind not being near the boardwalk a day or two since we were planning on visiting that area specifically anyway. Past the 100s seems to be a swankier part of town anyway. The hotel lobby and common areas are clean and inviting. The staff is nice. We didn't use the indoor pool because we used the outdoor one. It was in very good condition for a pool at a hotel near the beach, with very refreshing, cool, and clean water. It is bigger than many of the hotel pools and kind of kidney shaped rather than oblong. There were nice tables with umbrellas and lounge chairs around it. The only detraction was the maid service. The first day, our person never came to clean the room even though an envelope in our room identified her by name, and we left her what we thought was a good tip/incentive (also untouched). We had to report this and then they got someone in to clean the room within 5 minutes. We later noticed that this backup person didn't take away our old towels, though she did leave new ones. She forgot to leave us new shampoo and conditioner. The next day, our beds were made but the bathrooms were never really cleaned, they just left new towels and other stuff. I don't know if this was the hotel policy because it's a beach hotel where they get overwhelmed with constantly cleaning up sand and so have decided to just leave towels and tidy but not do the floors. It was a little annoying, but I felt like if that was the case, I kind of understood, because we were continually trooping sand in, and at least they were leaving new towels, cups, ice bags, etc., each time. The room was otherwise pleasant, with a little sitting area with a loveseat, coffee table, fridge, and microwave. I agree that the free breakfast never varied, which was a bit tiresome, but that could be easily remedied if they offered yogurt cups and cut fruit to break up the bready theme. On the other hand, if one took the time, one could vary it each day. I think most people are on their way out and rush and grab the mini muffins and cinnamon rolls. One could sit and have a bagel and cream cheese and a boiled egg one day or a bowl of cereal and create some variety. And hey, it's complimentary. In a town where eating can cost quite a bit, it's nice to get something in your stomach in the morning without shelling out more money. Also, the Fractured Prune is a short walk over to the strip mall next door if you want to pig out on the famous donuts. One of the best things about this hotel is where it is located. It is at 126th and Coastal, on the bay side. It is right next to a park where they have a wonderful 4th of July celebration each year. You can literally just walk across the parking lot to it. In a big field they put up huge moonbounces and other inflated obstacle courses, rock climbing wall, etc. They sell tickets that amount to about 50 cents per ride. Kids 8 or 9 and under will love this area. Then there's another adjacent field where they set up old timey arts and crafts stations with things you can buy, even llitlle folksy things like $1 grab bags for kids, and there were bands playing "beach music", plus lots of that good/bad food -- cheesesteaks, buffalo wings, funnel cakes, pizza, oyster fritter sandwiches, lemonade, hotdogs, ribs, chicken, ice cream, snowcones, etc. They set up lots of picnic tables with red and white checkered tablecloths. It's heavenly if you like your classic fourth of July celebration. At night, a spectacular fireworks display, the longest I've ever seen (and I've seen many) right there in the middle of a pretty uncrowded field. The finale to the fireworks was the most elaborate I've ever seen, almost as if they had something to prove or wanted to make sure absolutely no one left disappointed. I laughed and laughed and laughed as it went on and on and on. I told my friend that I'd just witnessed fireworks on viagra. Anyway, nowhere else in OC can you do everything you ever wanted to do in OC for the 4th of July and then be in your room having pillow fights with your kids within 5 minutes of the fireworks ending instead of trying to walk to your car and sweating out the humidity. There are also several good restaurants within walking distance. There is Tequila Mockingbird, which has excellent Mexican. There is Babe's blue ox steak house and raw bar. There is a dough roller and dumsers dairy (the only dumsers that sells oyster sandwiches). There is the Olive Tree, which was a little dingy and seemed an almost complete clone of Olive Garden as far as features (the sign out front and unlimited salad and breadsticks), but seemed to have much better food (a seafood marinara was excellent, with al dente pasta and seafood that was very fresh and not overcooked -- including the scallops)/the kid's pizza was an actual, nice, inspired pizza with spices and an excellent crust, not just thrown together as at so many restaurants. All in all, we'd probably stay here for any 4th of July at OC. For a different occasion, we might try to get a suite at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, with one caveat”
Reviews.Author: Steve888
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was OK. We travelled with our 2-year-old and got a "suite" (which was really just a room). There was a little bit of an off odor when we got off the elevator that persisted throughout the week. But it's a Holdiay In Express, so we weren't expecting 5-star accomodations. The room was clean , and we liked the fact that we had a fridge. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. They all learned our son's name and said Hi to him all the time. They had no problems with us moving our check-out time back an hour to enjoy an extra morning on the beach. The breakfast buffet was convenient, but not great, and it did not change from day to day (bagels, english muffins, cinnimon rolls, hard-boiled eggs, bananas, cold cereal, oatmeal, mini-muffins, and assorted breakfast drinks). It was OK for our purposes most mornings though. It's pretty far up the beach from the main strip - you won't be walking down to the boardwalk, but the section of beach was pretty nice and less crowded than some others, since there's no big hotel there. Our issue was that the hotel is actually pretty far away from the beach, especially when you have a 2-year old. The road you have to cross is six lanes wide, and the hotel is set pretty far back beyond that. Not too bad for adults or older kids, but toughfor a toddler. If we had it to do over again, we'd get a hotel on the other side of the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Coach99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a 3-day business trip. (The conference hotel was too expensive so we found the HI XP at a AAA rate very affordable.) The property is on the north end of Ocean City (about 2 miles from the Maryland/Delaware state line), away from the busy downtown and boardwalk areas. While we normally stay at oceanfront properties, this bayside property was nice. Upper floors facing west have the view of Assawoman Bay and 126th Street Northside Park. The park has walking trails along the bay, sports fields (baseball, soccer, lacrosse) and playground equipment for the kids. Shorebirds and a long public pier into the bay(available for fishing and crabbing) made for an enjoyable stay. The Atlantic Ocean, with public access to the sandy beach, is 1 block toward the east. The room with 2 queen beds and cable TV was clean and comfortable. It contained a microwave and small refrigerator. A continental breakfast (muffins, cinnamon rolls, cereal, juice, etc.) was included. The pool area was clean. I would recommend the HI XP for a nice relaxing stay when going "down the ocean, hon".

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Ocean City for business. This is a great hotel. I stayed in a king suite and it was very spacious, well furnished and spotless. Everything is very modern and up to date, unlike most of the hotel properties in Ocean City. I have stayed at about 8 different O.C. hotels and I think this hotel offers the best overall stay by far. The free breakfast offers some good choices to fill you up, especially the cinnamon rolls! The staff here was also very nice. The location is great. You are right across the street from the beach at 126th street and there are a number of good restaurants and shops within walking distance. The Blue Ox restaurant, right in front of the hotel, has incredible food and a cool bar attached to it with live entertainment. I tried the seafood pasta and a soft shell crab appetizer, it was heavenly! I highly recommend staying at Holiday Inn Express while in O.C.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Ocean City
HotelInfo.Address: 12601 Coastal Highway, Ocean City, MD 21842
